website_summaries.verdict: The Polk Command Bar's mix of features and elevated sound quality makes it the best Alexa-compatible sound bar yet.
pros: The Polk Command Bar offers built-in Alexa control that "hears" your voice more reliably than in competing Sonos speakers
With the help of a wireless subwoofer, sound quality is better than the Beam for both music and movies
A feast of connectivity options includes dual HDMI and the ability to mount a Fire TV Stick onboard
cons: The Polk has a narrower soundstage than Sonos Beam and lacks its ability to add rear speakers
It isn't (yet) compatible with Alexa multiroom
It's big, and not the most attractive sound bar on the market

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound bar with subwoofer that works as an Amazon Alexa
customer_reviews.text: -Easy to set up after you download the Polk Connect app. Just follow the instructions on screen to get it on the same wifi network. -About 15 min tops to set up -Great room-filing sound with a subwoofer included! All of the cords were included as well so I didnt have to order anything else. -Tested the system with the original Jurassic Park movie - simply amazing! -Night mode is great and doesn't wake up my wife or the kids when I am watching TV late. -I can raise or lower the volume by voice. Need to learn more commands. -It is an Amazon Alexa on steroids. -Amazing sound. Awesome value. I will be buying another for my living room.
customer_reviews.author: Art Morales

customer_reviews.title: was awesome
customer_reviews.text: Worked great when I first got it. Then, Alexa stopped working. She kept saying unable to connect to the internet even though all my other devices were connected just fine. Plus, it is 6 inches from the modem. There should be no problem why it does not connect. The sound is nice and the Alexa function works very good when it will actually connect. Everyday it gets worse. This will be going back soon if this problem continues. They only way to get it to connect is to unplug and then plug back in. That should not be how it works.
customer_reviews.author: stewwr

customer_reviews.title: Ugh, 6 months in and the remote stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to contact the manufacturer but they cannot get a response. Anyway, it's a fine soundbar, but the remote stopped working 6 months in and there's no way to get a replacement. A sound bar without a remote is pretty useless. The remote feels flimsy. Don't buy this one, search for one with a nice, stable remote.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Over Here the II

customer_reviews.title: It's a strip down dot with a awesome sound bar!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound,hands down but like everyone else states and many review's! Yes, it's a stand alone dot with a lot of selective features gone. If you like to use the dot for music and ask questions you might be ok with it but until the firmware syncs with amazon with other products ie multi-room I think it will be a good buy. I'm going to keep it for the sound bar because the price is right for a good sound bar on the market and amazon is a perk for what it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S.

customer_reviews.title: Best sound bar!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sound bar on the market right now. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a sound bar. You feel like you are really in the movie on game that you ate watching with the surround sound. The Alexa addition is very convenient and makes navigation and control of anything extremely simple. I definitely recommend purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: sarah h.

customer_reviews.title: So far GREAT, limited/different Alexa controls
customer_reviews.text: So far GREAT, limited/different Alexa controls, sounds good, has two HDMI in's one out. Easy wall or counter top mounting, easy wireless Sub linking. The Amazon/Alexa controls are different or limited, think of this as an Echo Dot sound bar. I connected it with a Fire Cube and video/sound all pass thru to my TV. Setup took a few tries, the Polk App had issues with the Amazon sing in. Looked at the Amazon setup and found the Bar assigned to me, then restarted the Polk App and it found the bar and finished the setup. Overall the Polk App is only for setup, kinda dumb just make an onscreen or button type setup via Amazon/Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Marc S.

customer_reviews.title: Failed to connect to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: After the initial success of connecting it and it working fine, it stopped connecting to the Wi-Fi and refuses no matter how many reinstall or powering redos. The Wi-Fi of course has remained fine for numerous other devices. Been unable to find solutions or support. Should be fine product but has not been and uncertain what to do.
customer_reviews.author: "kazevedo"

customer_reviews.title: Cheap sounding sound bar and Alexa doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I should've paid attention to the 3-star review on a Polk product, which is lower than a typical Polk product. I bought a Polk sound bar and subwoofer about 3 years ago for just under $300 and that unit sounds much better than this one. This sounds like a sound bar you can buy for $99. Oh, and the Alexa doesn't work. I sign into my Amazon account, via the Polk support app. Next screen asks to allow the sound bar to connect to Alexa. Guess what, it doesn't connect. It NEVER connects. So, I have a sound bar that sounds likes something you can buy for $99 and an Alexa that doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Great initial quality
customer_reviews.text: Virtually plug and play! Just follow the directions included in the box! Seeing up with alexa was slightly challenging. Again just dippre the directions and download the polk app. Limited alexa commands, but had main functions down. The sounds actually fit my best bedroom is fantastic for the money I spent. Had different sound modes for music, sports, and movie. Has unique night mode for reducing dynamic sound while lying in bed or my side is sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren and Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Alexa kept malfunctioning.
customer_reviews.text: Had the sound bar one month then it began malfunctioning. Alexa kept saying " I am having trouble understanding right now...". It would work fine for a few days after a reset but then fail again. I spoke with Polk Audio who told me to call Amazon I called Amazon who tried to send me back to Polk Audio. In the end my replacement is on its way from Amazon. I'll keep you posted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Speaker is good, Alexa is poor
customer_reviews.text: The speaker works great with the TV, but the Alexa has significant connectivity issues, as does the blue tooth. There needs to be a software upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: MARIE E. NADAL

customer_reviews.title: Not All Alexa features work
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like the Polk Soundbar with integrated Alexa. However, I have 2 other Alexa's in the house in a group. I cannot seem to add this Alexa to my group. Alexa comes back and says this feature is not available yet. I would really like to have all Alexa features available. Any chance this will become available?
customer_reviews.author: Michelle G

customer_reviews.title: Review revisited
customer_reviews.text: Updated review after 6 weeks of use. 5 stars to 3 stars. Opinion on Audio quality is still unchanged. But... Remote does not work. May have accidentally dropped a few times , but who hasn't dropped any remote in their lives! ARC connectivity is glitchy. Alexa connectivity needs to be reset a few times already. Original review: Can't beat the $100 discount at black Friday. Wanted Alexa-capable speaker with HDMI ACR connectivity for LG 65PU60 HDR smart TV. Easy install using app. Great sound and balance. Compared to comparable priced sound bars like Bose sound bar 5 and Samsung, this one stands up to the competition.
customer_reviews.author: Francis M12

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set up
customer_reviews.text: I really like the sound and the ease of setting this up. Only concern I had was the packaging was really bad. The equipment was not damaged. I don't understand why it was shipped with such bad packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Clark

customer_reviews.title: Regretful Purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. The Alexa feature works intermittently and flashes green. It has to be reset up almost daily and is constantly giving me an error message. I called Alexa support and they told me to call Polk. I called Polk and he said the Alexa dot in the middle could only be handled by Alexa service. Called Alexa service again and they said it’s a third party. It can not communicate with the other Polk bar that is exactly the same (I mistakenly bought two hoping they could play music throughout the house). Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LindasLegacyBeautique

customer_reviews.title: High value for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I wish you could crank more bast base into it. I do like how they did the 3 D sound.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Price

customer_reviews.title: Worst Echo Enabled Product
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this item any less. The Echo mist be rebooted every 30 to 45 minutes when streaming music and often just gets "stuck". If you like the visual ambiance of the spinning blue ring for hours at a time, then its fantastic. Volume control on remote is ridiculous as well...you want to tun it up or down some? Prepare for tunnel carpel of your finger because you will have press it no less than 10 times for any appreciable change. Absolutely terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: GM ATL

customer_reviews.title: Not Ready For Prime Time
customer_reviews.text: After trying this for a week, we decided to return it. The sound quality playing music was good but for TV audio, not so much. We also found that every morning we had to unplug the HDMI cable from the TV set and re insert it to get the sound going. There were just too many issues that made what should be seamless TV watching a real pain the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Rattlesnake

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need if you don't want to waste money on a big system
customer_reviews.text: The Polk command takes a few mintues to set up properly and get Alexa working, but once you set it up the soundbar is a joy. Being able to play music by voice command, or control the volume is smooth. However, like a woman, sometimes Alexa will ignore you the first time you say something. It's easy to set up bluetooth, and is very easily integrated with any tv.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R.

customer_reviews.title: Major Lemon!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! They really messed this one up. And the ridiculous app you have to download to use it is even worse. This thing has so many connection problems I spend more time reconnecting it than using it that they should've paid me to own this junk. Seriously, the biggest rip-off, lemon in history. Do not even waste your time thinking twice. Do what Sandy Gross did & bolt as fast as you can from this garbage. I rebought this junk after the first time. How stupid I feel now.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: A quality product
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar is great! Pros: Great sound Easy setup 4K HDR ability Cons: Subwoofer not very big & sound not very deep Customer support is non-existent (I asked for help to reset my password over a month ago and never received a response, and yes, I used their reset password link and I STILL was not able to log in. I tried this 5 times, and no luck! I called their customer support and was told to send an email to support for help, which is what I did before I called. I am still not able to log in to my account!) Come on Polk, get your support fixed!
customer_reviews.author: G. Gallo

customer_reviews.title: Updated 9/25/20  AVOID
customer_reviews.text: I must first state that I do NOT recommend this product. It was poorly designed, and is completely and utterly unsupported by Polk in my experience. Try as I might, I received no help whatsoever from Polk. Not that they even tried. I got sent to the same lame and useless FAQ page constantly Avoid this purchase. Networking nightmare that will lose wireless (it can only access wireless) connection all of the time. ping testing shows that this cannot maintain a connection for more than a minute at a time. TERRIBLE!
customer_reviews.author: All the Good Names are taken!

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, well priced.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up through my Samsung TV HDMI ARC port. I set this up, turned it on and it automatically connects. The only issue, and I think it is a samsung issue, is that when I change volume with my xfinity remote, something from the tv pops up to tell me the volume level. It immediately goes away, but I wish it never popped up.
customer_reviews.author: richmac

customer_reviews.title: Relatively easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to setup. For $300, surprisingly powerful sound with good bass from the subwoofer. Great to be able to get Alexa in the living room integrated with my TV experience.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!! Loses connection to wifi constantly.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed good at first but the Echo Dot has limited function. I have had constant issues with connectivity. The device frequently loses connection with my network and you have to go through a rather lengthy process to reconnect it as a new device every time. Recently it has lost connection more frequently and I reached out to the Polk support. They asked what router I had which I told them. I have had no further reply in over a week. Buy a sound bar and Echo separately!
customer_reviews.author: Allister

customer_reviews.title: Alexa, sell this piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: I bought his with high expectations of using the integrated Amazon assistant while enjoying great sound. Unfortunately, although the sound is ok (not great), the Amazon assistant capability is useless. Despite numerous attempts to get help from Polk "tech support" over a period of months, the sound bar continuously loses its WIFI connection. This started about 3 or 4 months after installation. No other devices in the house lose their wifi connection at all. much less continuously. And it's sitting right next to a wifi repeater. I am going to see if I can dump this on someone who doesn't care about the wifi part and just wants a sound bar, and then get something reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Music Critic

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice system but kinda complicated
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice system and it includes Alexa which is nice. However, the system is a little difficult to use. The voice commands sometimes Work sometimes they don’t. When you tell the system to mute it mutes for only a few seconds and then it turns it back up to full volume. It’s easy to connect Bluetooth and other devices. But if you have another Alexa in the vicinity, it does make it a little complicated because they don’t know which one to listen to.
customer_reviews.author: K&L

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good - Alexa issues
customer_reviews.text: Updated / upgraded to a receiver less setup above the fireplace. sound bar is very slim and fit in less than 3 inch height. The sub is wireless and can be placed nearby. Has several sound modes. The Alexa needs work. The Alexa in the sound bar tends to hear everything better and overrides our existing Alexa however the sound bar Alexa cant do basic things we need like set timers. Our existing Alexa can switch the hdmi or turn the volume up on the sound bar. Weve had to choose which one we wanted. We turned the mic off on the sound bar.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E. Wenger

customer_reviews.title: Solid audio solution for minimalists
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar is a better overall purchase than I expected. I have owned other sound bars in a similar price range. This one has superior sound and function. I connectivity with Amazon fire stick works well although there is a slight delay when first turning everything on. TV sounds great both streaming from an app or receiving a digital signal through a standard indoor antenna. Music plays and sounds great via bluetooth. Had sports mode for optimal game time sound. I purchased for $300, at $250 it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: OC Dead Head

customer_reviews.title: Great sound BUT "Alexa" feature has bugs
customer_reviews.text: Unit is very good operationally but has a bizarre "Alexa" issue. I had Alexa echo remind me daily to take a medication as I'm very forgetful, so when I decided to replace my old soundbar I was happy to get the Polk Commander with built in Alexa and I added my medication reminders into it. Unfortunately, it doesn't work! I get seemingly random reminders at wrong times of the day and some missed ones completely. Definitely not a reliable source. After researching online, I find many people have had issues with it and Polk will not or cannot fix it. The music is great but not the complete package I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Warpcore

customer_reviews.title: Great Polk Audio - not quite Seamless integration with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: The improvement in sound quality (versus either the Alexa device or the TV speakers) is astronomical. The subwoofer provides solid bass and the soundbar is excellent in midrange and treble. The modes provided on the remote provide a convenient means of customizing audio output (music, sports). The downside is customer support, which is sorely lacking. The instructions refer to a specific "Polk Command Bar" Alexa Skill, which is non-existent (and apparently unnecessary as Alexa worked without learning a new skill.
customer_reviews.author: Cul1

customer_reviews.title: Great sound bar, atrocious Alexa integration
customer_reviews.text: The sounds bar is amazing with great sound, we use the arc input with almost no problems. Occasionally we have to reboot the sounds bar when switching inputs (about once every other week), but I believe that is due to a cheap tv and not this soundbar. The Amazon Alexa integration, however, is absolutely horrible! It is constantly locking up and going into listening mode for no reason. We now keep the mute button on at all times, but since we have an echo in every room anyway, this is not to big of a downside. Just be warned not to purchase this if you expect to use it as another echo.
customer_reviews.author: vin

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: I’m on my second Polk sound bar, and it’s failed. 30 days after the end of the warranty. Just like the first one, the Amazon Echo functionality has failed. It recognized the “Alexa” control word, but just mutes the TV audio and waits until it times out. The device shoes as offline in the Amazon Alexa app, regardless of its real state. And truthfully, the sound quality is pretty poor. Given the low price, I guess that’s to be expected, and I’d put up with it if the Echo integration actually worked. Another good lesson in “you get what you pay for”. The low price of this device should have been enough of a warning for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Proctor

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Spent two hours trying to get it to connect to my wifi with no luck... tried calling their support line and it just says 'experiencing high call volume try again later' this is also when I called them during my lunch hour they had someone call me when it was my turn. Cool. Called back right at the end of my lunch hour and then said for the command bar I have to go to a different line and then got offered to call when it was my turn again... never called. Sounds pretty good for music... delays video running through my xbox looking for fix for that currently
customer_reviews.author: Jake Klocke

customer_reviews.title: Polk Command Bsr nightmare
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. Could never get HDMI ARC output to work. Was on the phone with support for over an hour and nothing was resolved. On top of that the remote stopped working. I asked that they send me a new bar but he just ignored that. I bought this because I believed it would enhance tv. It’s been nothing short of a nightmare. $299 wasted.
customer_reviews.author: FL lifestyle

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you don't intend to use Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. I had it for three days before returning. I didn't intend to use Alexa, it shouted at me repeatedly to tell me Alexa wasn't connected. It requires downloading an app and creating a Polk account. After doing that, the app had no useful settings anyway. It started updating itself twice while I was in the middle of a show which required quite a long pause before sound was available. It froze twice and had to be unplugged and powered back on. All I wanted was a soundbar, not an interactive app driven device.
customer_reviews.author: SLM

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, HORRIBLE alexa support.
customer_reviews.text: The bar itself has great sound, but the Alexa functionality is lacking and often broken. Timers constantly just disappear without ever going off, the device often freezes and has to be unplugged and replugged back in to work at all. The last update really seems to have decreased the effectiveness of the integrated Alexa. Here's to hoping polk gets a decent update out soon, cause we are thinking of returning this.
customer_reviews.author: eanders

customer_reviews.title: Tried to sneak an Alexa to my parents
customer_reviews.text: Soundbar on par with others in its price range. Easy to set up and works well. Very few reboots needed. I was hoping that my aging mother would use the Alexa functionality to listen to country music, something she used to do all be it with an old school radio. No luck with that, some people just do not take to new technology. The best aspect from my point of view is My parents' don't need to blast the tv as loud. The fuller clearer sound from it allows them to hear the tv much better than the built-in speakers. They still have it loud, but no longer obnoxiously so.
customer_reviews.author: Bjmarks

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good, Alexa is flaky
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about a year and half now (as of 3/20/2020). The soundbar actually sounds pretty darn good for the price. The only problem I have with it is it seems to forget it's setting (HDMI 1, 2, or TV) randomly. Also, after about 3 weeks, Alexa starts having problems. It gets "stuck" trying to perform an action. You have to reboot the sound bar to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Remote Inoperative
customer_reviews.text: Great Sound, Remote Inoperative. This sound bar was very easy to set up with the downloaded app from Polk. The sub-woofer linked right up with no issues and the system sounds great. The Remote didn't work at all. I called and got Amazon tech support, Polk was not answering that day. Amazon couldn't resolve the issue but gave me a credit that allowed me to order another remote from a third party. If the remote had worked this would have received a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Hines

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but can give problems connecting to the internet - Found a solution
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great on the sound bar and initially I was totally frustrated as after connecting with the Polk Connect App the system would constantly display an Error message, not connected to the internet. Tried messaging Polk on FB and joined their forum but no response. Then I decided to "press the setup button and the microphone button simultaneously for about 5 seconds". After I asked Alexa if she was connedted to the internet and she responded yes. Problem solved. So all those who are having the internet cconnection error, try going through the above step after the setup process in the app.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Could have been good.
customer_reviews.text: This thing could have been good. When it works, it’s great. However, it often needs to be rebooted. Sometimes it won’t pick up the input. Occasionally the sound drops out for a second or two rendering dialog difficult to listen to. This only happens about twice an hour though. The worst thing though is that when you adjust the volume, it gets staticky or drops out briefly. I had hoped software updates would fix this but I’ve had it since December and no such luck yet.
customer_reviews.author: W. Belisle

customer_reviews.title: FRUSTRATING
customer_reviews.text: This is the most frustrating device I have ever bought. I had a separate Alexa echo dot with a Vizio sound bar and it worked GREAT. Now I try to upgrade to this built in Alexa Polk soundbar and it SUCKS. Any time I ask it to do something I can’t get it to go back to tv audio without turning off the tv. Sound is mediocre when it works. Not worth the headache or cost.
customer_reviews.author: milo27

customer_reviews.title: Not a true Amazon echo device
customer_reviews.text: The is not a true echo device. I wanted to set the wake word, so my device would not wake each other. Not going to happen as Amazon did not fully install the programming on the echo device in the sound bar. I should have read more comments on the reviews about this device. Do not buy what for a true Amazon echo sound bar to come out.
customer_reviews.author: Grthorto

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, No Multi-Room Audio with other Alexas
customer_reviews.text: I currently have 7 Amazon Alexa speakers throughout my house and use the multi-room audio feature. I bought this thinking that the Commandbar would sync with the rest of the speakers, IT DOES NOT! Very disappointed, for this price you can get a much better quality soundbar.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Komisarek

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 👍
customer_reviews.text: This is a great combination of technology with the soundbar and echo dot combo. If you're looking for a lot better quality then your TV speakers or your basic soundbar, then this is for you! The only reason it didn't get 5 stars from me would be because some of the commands have to be exact in order to perform the function. Although my other dot took some time and learned newer commands as time went on, so maybe that'll be the case here. Nevertheless, it works great, easy setup and great quality especially with the addition of the wireless subwoofer that is a really nice boost for the money as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cweed

customer_reviews.title: Great sound with an Alexa connection makes a great combo
customer_reviews.text: I have not experienced any of the negative issues that I have seen some reviews reporting. The convenience of being able to give verbal commands to play and artist, song label or albums from Amazon prime music and Pandora, Spotify, et. al. is a wonderful benefit. I am actually using my sound bar not with my TV but as a sound system on my covered back porch. It sounds so good that several of our friends have bought the Polk sound bar for themselves after hearing ours. I heartily recommend this sound bar and its excellent wireless sub-woofer combo. Great sound and great convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Steve C

customer_reviews.title: Was not impressed at all.
customer_reviews.text: The remote was the first item to go under. Would only operate within 3 feet of unit. Spoke to Tech Support and was to have a replacement control within 4-6 days. Well that did not happen and it took over two weeks. By this time I was tired of telling Alexa to work the volume. Adding to that, my wife and I really did not want the Alexa function. Concerned about intrusiveness. When switching the volume there would be a lag before audio was heard again and you would have to rewind the broadcast to understand. Not impressed with this one, hence this is why we switched to a Yamaha YAS-207BL. Now this unit is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Curly

customer_reviews.title: Great but not for Alexa lol
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is top notch, and the range is awesome. Some of the best Bass ive ever had from a soundbar. Sadly, the product is insanely glitchy, the Alexa does not integrate well with my echo dots, and the Alexa cant even really integrate with my tv (also Alexa enabled). This product would be great if it were not Alexa branded and were just here for the sound quality, but because it didnt deliver on its major benefit and differentiating perk I’m pretty pissed I bought this and would rather have just bought the unflashy new Vizio
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Scolnic

customer_reviews.title: Switches inputs when you don’t want it to
customer_reviews.text: “Alexa play pandora” “okay here’s ‘random station’ on pandora”. 1 minute later. It switches input back to TV. “Alexa play pandora” 30 seconds later switches back to TV. Called for tech support. “Sir why would you ever want your tv on and not have that Input selected?” I asked if he was really asking me that. He rudely told me that I should not have the tv plugged into the sound bar if I want to listen to something else. Really? Really? I can’t imagine that that is really polks answer but for now I will figure out how to return this garbage. If anyone knows how to fix this, I’d appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Spubie

customer_reviews.title: It worked well for 10 months and then went kaput.  Mainly the Alexa portion
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this polk for my samsung smart TV and it worked like a charm! The remote control specifically has a “speech or dialogue booster” (which really helps for those poor-audio netflix movies that have dialogue). The alexa was a great benefit too. But, with all the Alexa updates and lack of Polk updates (the Polk app is extremely rudimentary and essentially useless), the sound bar stopped working for Alexa for about 2 months. Then, today it just died. I think this product would have been far superior if it did not meege with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Keun-young Anthony Kim

customer_reviews.title: Needs more work
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the technology does not fully support the idea. The embedded Echo Dot frequently shows active (circling blue/green lights) and stops responding. I've had to plug it into a smart plug so I could turn it off and on to reset. Also, the Dot doesn't consistently speak back phrases when included in an Alexa routine. It "thinks" for up to 15 second and sometimes says it and sometimes does not. There is also no separate volume control for the Dot so when you speak to Alexa it shouts back a response at the same volume as the TV. I had it exchanged and the same issues persisted. Polk customer service is also low quality. I expected more from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzolito

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but drops network
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, but keeps dropping of the network. If you have a firestick, you can voice command the remote and it's fine,but the sound bar says "Sorry but I'm having trouble right now". Reconnect by running setup again and it's fine for a while, but eventually drops again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Zaragoza

customer_reviews.title: Works even in a large room
customer_reviews.text: I received this about two weeks ago and put it in my gym which is upstairs of a 3 car garage. The room is about 20 feet by 30 feet with a high ceiling. The TV I have there is impossible to hear so I thought buying this would hopefully solve my issue so I can actually hear the TV! Well It was very easy to install and makes a huge difference. It's very loud and I don't even need to turn it all the way up! I highly recommend this item, sound quality is great and installation is pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: Al Kenney

customer_reviews.title: No multi-room music support
customer_reviews.text: Sounds fine - but doesn't work with multi-room support. I purchased this device in May 2019 (from Best Buy) and immediately discovered this problem. I called Tech Support, they said it was a "known issue" and they were "working on it with Spotify" (For what it's worth, the same problem exists with Pandora). 7 months later I called and got the full on royal runaround. I want my money back as the device clearly doesn't operate as promised and advertised.
customer_reviews.author: SF_Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, nice having Alexa built in, needs a few things though
customer_reviews.text: Overall I've been happy with the sound bar and sound quality. The sub woofer is pretty good too. Everything I would expect in that aspect. The items that prevent me from 5 stars? Sub woofer is big and plasticy looking (because it is). The sound bar has a nice look to it, couldn't they do something for the sub? There should be a separate volume for Alexa. Don't need Alexa yelling at me when I've got the volume up for a movie or music. There was some initial frustration with Alexa connection flakiness too but it seems like a recent over the air upgrade has improved that.
customer_reviews.author: griz

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good, the Alexi feature is poorly engineered, luckily I didn’t buy for this feature Set up with HDMI was an unnecessary burden. Tried routing cable box and blu Ray to the sound bar and run hdmi ARC from soundbar to TV. Didn’t work. Had to run each component to TV. You get what you pay for with this system. Contacted Polk Audio, they were no help. Won’t be buying from this manufacturer again.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I liked mine so much that I bought another for my dad, and also recommended to a neighbor. They are both very happy with it too. Having a fully capable Alexa built it is huge. We had an echo in the room already but immediately moved it to a different room after purchasing this sound bar. None of us use the HDMI interface. The optical interface does everything we need. We routinely use this thing at parties - all the guests can just yell out songs and Alexa obeys.
customer_reviews.author: SW Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know anything about sound bars, but I love high-quality sound. We have Alexa products all over our house, and overall, we are growing frustrated with what has become an almost-constant need to reconnect the devices to our Wi-Fi. This device is no different; it seems like it's daily telling us that it's not connected and to reestablish the connection. Ugh. What's more: the remote is frustrating. You have to make sure that it is directly aimed at the sound bar, even raised up above your head to make sure that it works. The sound, though! The sound is clean and crisp. The lows are quite deep, and the highs are bright. The sound, by my taste, is rich.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, terrible product
customer_reviews.text: It's a shame that this sound bar's software is utter garbage because the hardware is actually pretty good. It has great audio quality, but refuses to connect to any of the HDMIs plugged into it after abiut twi days. Doesn't fail to lose connection every single time. Oh, want to use optical? Enjoy your video sync going out after a week or so. It is impossible to recommend this. The Alexa sucks, the voice commands work 30% if the time, and it disconnects the HDMI passthrough ports. 1/5
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: A good sound bar with one potentially fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: While the quality of this sound bar is good, and it has built-in Alexa, it's fatal flaw is that the manufacturer did not provide TiVo with the codes/frequencies needed to make it possible to control the sound bar using TiVo's awesome remote. I don't want to have to use two remotes, and it is frequently inconvenient to use voice commands to adjust the volume (you end up missing parts of the dialogue). This is a simple, but major, problem that Polk should remedy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Radway

customer_reviews.title: Would like it better without Alexa
customer_reviews.text: The sound bar itself works fine, audio sounds good, but the Alexa integration is mediocre at best. She often freezes when we ask to change the volume, or simply doesn’t respond. The remote control works, so the Alexa part just makes it all annoying. First world problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound for the Value
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the easy set up and how nice the sound is. The ONLY part I had an issue with was getting connected to the internet through the app. After going in a couple times and having alexa run an update, it worked perfectly. Great clear sound and full bass. Would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a great quality, reasonably priced sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Sound bar had decent sound for the price, however the Alexa function was basically worthless. It never worked, and even interrupted sound on a regular basis. The BIGGEST issue was that I paid $250 for a nice sound set-up, and with-in a year, it died. Just stopped turning on. I tried calling Polk customer service, and the answering service tells me that they are sorry, they are busy, and goodbye. That's right... it just hangs up on you. I have sent e-mails, and if I ever do hear back, and they make it right, I will change my review. I bought Polk because I had respect for the brand... perhaps I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Hippo

customer_reviews.title: alexa programming issue
customer_reviews.text: Yes it has Alexa but since its a separate app on my phone, it doesn't completely work with fire tv. We have issues playing/pausing Fire TV, Netflix. Hulu, etc. It says that feature is not there. I went on the apps to put the feature on and Netflix or Hulu is not on the list. It only has cable companies and I don't have cable. That's why I got Fire TV! Also when I turn the TV on with the Fire remote it only turns/recognizes the sound bar half the time. I end up having to use the sound bar remote to switch it to the sound bar.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hoadley

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Sound
customer_reviews.text: I'm all over the place on this one. The sound does sound really well. However, it's super quiet and then super loud out of nowhere. It makes it so you need the remote in your hand always. The remote doesn't work especially well. I wish you could do more on the app. Almost no control allowed through Polk Connect. Overall it's nice, but there are better cheaper ones and better more expensive ones. I would go with one of those options.
customer_reviews.author: Timasil Guespe

customer_reviews.title: Did you try turning it off and on again?
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar sounds great but there are major software issues that make it unreliable and almost unusable. Sound bar regularly disconnects from CEC requiring the TV to rescan. When using the echo function to steam music from amazon music it plays a few songs and then just stops. Revisited—Now it seems that this sound bar is just in a constant reboot cycle. It’s too bad it’s a good sounding sound bar crippled by a software issue.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M. Webster

customer_reviews.title: i would buy this again for $199 (price i paid on sale pre christmas 2018)
customer_reviews.text: no major issues since the firmware update has made the Polk alexa compatible with my other echo/dot devices. also the fact that you need to press the polk remote to return TV control after using pure Alexa for questions or music is not readily known but after calling very helpful Polk customer service i was told about it. its loud enough and rocks the room with the subwoofer, much less hassle than my previous surround sound wired speakers. I recommend this soundbar.
customer_reviews.author: JP4120

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as expected
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I asked Alexa anything, the answer was always "I'm sorry I don't understand or do not have that in my data base" I am 100% american with no accent, so I'm not hard to understand and I never asked for anything other than to turn the sound on because half the time the sound would shut off completely. It was very frustration, especially when I was watching a movie or game. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Emory

customer_reviews.title: Great and 360 clear sound! Completed our whole house sound system
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the clear sound! Our old LG soundbar was on its last leg and chopping out. We tied this in on a group with a few echos and have music throughout the whole house and patio now. We could instantly tell a difference with smoother vocals, bass and sound effects. Sounds 360! It was easy to setup to control the volume with our own TV remote and also an Apple TV remote. Plus it’s cool I can mute never ending commercials of sporting events without even having the remote nearby. Alexa, mute! Unmute! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Young

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality of tech, good sound
customer_reviews.text: The remote stopped working almost immediately, which is obviously problematic. I have a message into customer support so maybe that item can be replaced, but it doesn’t speak well to the quality of the product. Still sounds nice though.
customer_reviews.author: AJW

customer_reviews.title: Causes wifi interference
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this item cause I wanted the Alexa part. For the price I think it's a decent speaker. I havent been able to figure out how to control the volume with my tv remote. I really haven't dove into that much because my biggest issue is its causing wifi interference with my TV. I cant get ahold of polk support as they are only open 10 to 6 and haven't emailed me back yet... been weeks since I sent email. Long story short its unplugged and not being used cause it causes wifi issues for my tv. Debating about returning. I cant find anywhere to change channel. Not happy with overall experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: The Command Bar disconnects from apps after a few minutes. In addition, the sound clicks off every few minutes. Despite numerous calls to Tech Support, they weren't able to resolve any of my problems. I returned it to Best Buy after six weeks. I'm very disappointed in Polk!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Odell J.

customer_reviews.title: Great soundbar despite limitation
customer_reviews.text: This is a great soundbar. The quality of sound is excellent; especially, coupled with its subwoofer. Very easy to set up and benefits by using Amazon Fire or Roku Stick. Alexa voice is embedded in the controls. You can use voice to increase or decrease volume. The limitation is that you cannot use the Alexa feature as a timer or as an alarm. For some reason, this feature is disabled and that is a mistake.
customer_reviews.author: D. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Intall with iPhone
customer_reviews.text: Once successfully installed the sound bar has been a great addition for our family room TV. However, after several failed attempts to setup via Windows 10 PC, I almost boxed it back up and returned it. It setup just fine on the first pass with my iPhone 10. Just save yourself some grief and do it that way. The only problem we've had since is the volume often doesn't come on after the TV has been off awhile until pressing HDMI1 on the sound bar's remote control. This is not a major inconvenience once you know it. Overall a good deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Prairie Gary

customer_reviews.title: Remote sucks and you really do need it!!
customer_reviews.text: Had it about 6 months and the remote stopped working. Obviously I replaced the batteries and confirmed they were good. The issue is the very specific sound modes. You need an actual remote for this sound bar to control those. Ordered a replacement remote and that one stopped working after 2 months. Both times they stopped working we were stuck in night mode. Apparently this is a common problem with this sound bar. If you search the topic you'll find forums of people complaining about it happening to them as well. Likely just going to need to buy something new that works!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Wolff

customer_reviews.title: Loses connection way too much
customer_reviews.text: This product was released way before it should have been. This was a sad attempt at a cash grab from polk. The soundbar loses connection randomly and frequently and you have to set it up over and over again. It only has half of the alexa features??? Dont release the product if its not complete. Soundbar sounds great but works horribly
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: Purchased November 2018 and my first bar Alexa integration stopped working in December 2019 - Polk did replace the bar even though the 1-year warranty had just expired. This was an awesome customer experience. However, the replacement bar just died (will not power on). While this is not the most expensive soundbar on the market, I would still expect it to last longer than a year (or less).
customer_reviews.author: D. Ohrt

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great sound
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to use and install, great sound, and good bass. Cons: Every once and while the sound won't come out. Restarting has always worked but it has happened often enough to mention it. Also sometimes it gets confused when a commercial says "Hey Alexa" and the sound will turn off while Alexa waits for a command. That one I actually find that one kind of funny but it is still annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Chivas

customer_reviews.title: Great Alexa Integration
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a decent priced soundbar, so I did a bunch of research (I asked the dude at Best Buy) and he demo'd it for me. I liked the fact that it had an HDMI slot for the Firestick and a built in "Alexa". I'm not a sound guy so I got it home, set it up and played Apocalypse Now, then Blade Runner 2049, then The Avengers. The sound was fantastic! I've had no issues to date and love it. THe remote is a bit odd to me but all in all I love it.
customer_reviews.author: rdcurrie

customer_reviews.title: No manual, no customer service
customer_reviews.text: No manual was included. I hooked the sound bar up to my TV, and no sound comes out. I tried reading the FAQs on the app, but instead it took me to a shopping page. Been on hold for 10 minutes trying to get help, and have to keep listening to the same annoying voice talking about COVID-19 UPDATE: I finally got it working. Installed and functional only three days ago, and it's already crackling!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hof

customer_reviews.title: Difficult setup; unreliable connection
customer_reviews.text: I have occasional connectivity problems with this product. I was just watching a show and the audio just stopped. The sound bar was still connected and responded to volume changes from the TV, but no sound. If it were a simple matter of a power cycle, this would be inconvenient, but not terrible. Instead I now get to spend half an afternoon wrestling with the inadequate and oversimplified setup app to try to get the sound back. I did a factory reset and it now seems to be stuck in setup mode. This kind of product should be plug and play. There's no reason for this to be so difficult.
customer_reviews.author: dgreenawald

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Soundbar With Alexa!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this soundbar its sounds are amazing and the style is very appealing, comes with a nice bass speaker.it has Alexa built in which saves room for those thinking of getting an Amazon Echo, with this soundbar no need for an extra device.if you have an Amazon stick it has a section within the soundbar to connect your stick and provide power for it as well. overall it's a great soundbar with its added Alexa features
customer_reviews.author: jaticeo

customer_reviews.title: buy a different model and save the $$$
customer_reviews.text: But a different system please. It drives me crazy. It looses interest all the time and you have to go through the whole set up process again. At least twice a month. Plus every time you turn on the TV its a guess on whether or not it connects and at what volume. the Alexa doesn't always work and often the volume is out of sync with the Sony XBR. I am sure the Vizio for $100 less would be just as good. I am a Polk Audio fan and thought the quality of the sound would be superior. my other option was the Yamaha and I should have gone with that.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Botvinick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound and base
customer_reviews.text: Alexa is malfunctioning. The base and soundbar are always left on. For some reason, the subwoofer was not playing and I had to unplug and plug the device then it worked. I asked alexa to remind my medication and it announces on the speaker for the 1st 3 days I connected it after that it does not announce anymore just a text on my phone since I have the app installed.
customer_reviews.author: hiteknoligi

customer_reviews.title: For the money, this is it!!
customer_reviews.text: I believe this is the best sound at you’ll find for the $200 price tag! Alexa is a huge bonus, too. It’s amazing to just walk into the room and ask Alexa to play a song and...Bam! There it is.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: NOT an Alexa replacement.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sounds great as a TV soundbar for sure, however, I bought this so I wouldn't need an Alexa to pair via Bluetooth, and I should've done that instead because this thing can only do about 80% of what Alexa's can do. It can't set reminders, it can't sync with my Echo Clock, Alarms only work 50% of the time, and drops wifi signal like once a month at least, and it's a pain in the butt to set up with WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this command bar for at least a year. What seems like an awesome product idea is completely wasted on terrible implementation. It’s maddeningly frustrating that the Alexa part of this does not work reliably. I’ve had to factory reset it at least a half dozen times since we’ve owned it. Other echos in completely different rooms respond better and the speaker bar just sits muted while they do the job it SHOULD be doing. The audio quality is just so so. You can do much better for the price. Save yourself the headache and just buy a nice sound bar and a separate echo dot. This is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Quirky but livable
customer_reviews.text: I really love the sound quality for my small area. The sub helps fill the room. Alexa integration is pretty cool. I replaced an Echo Dot I was using in the living room before the command bar. The TV HDMI input doesn't automatically connect when I power my Toshiba Fire TV on, I have to use the command b ar remote to activate the TV port. Kinda of a pain. Maybe a firmware update for the command bar? Maybe the TV? I don't know, it's just inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Russell

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great but if you are looking for an Alexa device with all functionality of an Echo, this is not it. This is simply a voice controlled speaker that uses Alexa as the voice. I can not control my Ring cameras, it’s does not make calls or drop ins. You cannot make it a part of a group in order to play music everywhere. It will not even use any of the skills I commonly use like Dish and it’s connected to the Dish satellite receiver. They say they are working on updates to incorporate more Alexa functions. I wish I would have waited or did more research prior to purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Choose a different soundbar
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar sounds good and the bass is quality. But unfortunately that's where the good things end. The voice volume is low and it can be hard to hear people talk. The built in Alexa constantly has problems. It doesn't stay connected to to music groups. Recently the soundbar will not stay on the selected HDMI input. If I could choose again, I would certainly select a different soundbar.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Good to See Here
customer_reviews.text: The built in Alexa is awful. It is so loud first of all and can’t really see how to change this. Rarely does it work and a poor replacement for my Echo. It’s like half the time i use Alexa it takes like 1-2 minutes for it to finally respond. Secondly I have to reconnect the dang thing to WiFi at least 2-3 times a week. It’s soooo annoying. If you want a sound bar with built in Alexa this is not the one to pick. Frankly if my best friend hadn’t purchased it as a gift I would toss this in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound quality! Very Happy!
customer_reviews.text: This Polk system has a 6 inch subwoofer which provides awesome bass and Alexa is built in, just really great quality sound. Got this system on sale end of year at Best Buy for $299.00. I was really amazed at the power and quality, I have several Bose speakers, Wave system and headphones so I had other great quality products to compare it to. Not disappointed 😁
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Alexa + soundbar = bad times
customer_reviews.text: The software support for the soundbar is horrific. Alexa constantly gets hung up trying to complete commands, I find myself having to reboot the sound bar once ever few weeks as Alexa will become completely unresponsive. Don't get me wrong the sound is pretty good, the sub woofer is too sensitive to the point I have just unplugged it and don't use it. So long story short Alexa + Soundbar = bad times, buy a sound bar without the Alexa integration.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but complete junk.
customer_reviews.text: Bout this in 2018. The sound quality is really good. However, the Echo feature is horrible. When it works it’s fine. But I have to unplug (reboot) the thing at least once a day because it just freezes when I give it a command. It’s extremely frustrating and if there is a way to disable the Alexa part I want to know what that is. I would not recommend this product if you want to maintain your sanity.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Long

customer_reviews.title: Updated with MRM!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this about 2 years now I first bought it before Multi room music was available and that was disappointing but now that they made the update this is exactly what I wanted good sound quality and now I can play music throughout the home with all my Alexa devices.
customer_reviews.author: joseph morea

customer_reviews.title: Great unit.
customer_reviews.text: Good looking, great sound and easy to setup. Unable to add this device to my everywhere group, but hoping an update will take care of that. One more HDMI port would have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Hegstad

customer_reviews.title: Sound not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have difficulty understanding the voices on TV. The ad said this would provide great, easy to understand voices. It does not. Also, the volume does not get ant louder than my TV speakers. I will probably be returning it...f I can get it back in the box>
customer_reviews.author: Paladin McGee

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: This device does not play well with any devices. Doesn’t like echo. Doesn’t like Bluetooth. Doesn’t like to sync with peoples mouths on tv. Doesn’t even like the fire stick it was built for. Lip sync issue has an on screen scale to help sync but the scale goes in the wrong direction. THIS product is not a smart device it’s the opposite. Polk has been near the top with their audio quality for ages and the sound quality is pretty good but everything else has been a huge disappointment. Don’t buy this product expecting it to work with anything other than what comes in the box. I will definitely return this piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: Graham Heath

customer_reviews.title: Had this for 2 months... I wish i didn’t..
customer_reviews.text: Pros: • Sound quality is great. • Built in Alexa. Cons: • Disconnects from Bluetooth like crazy. • A limit to how low the bass can be. • Will (sometimes but not too often) make a little noise that’s kinda quite and almost sounds like a little jiggle. • (personally) I wish Alexa had a option to disconnect from WiFi. Usually disconnecting the power cable will fix everything but 30-40% of the time. I wouldn’t recommend this product to anyone. I honestly wish I could give this back. I’ve had this product for 2 month so there’s nothing i can do. This polk company only wants to troubleshoot but that will only get you so far.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew p.

product_meta.title: Polk Audio Command Sound Bar with Handsfree Amazon Alexa Voice Control (New Update with Multi-Room Music Built-In), 4K HDMI, and Fire TV Compatible for Your Home Theater
